meanings.definition: Make or become English in form or character.
meanings.sent1: She anglicized her name to fit in better at school.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant anglicized its menu to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat anglicized its meow to sound more like a British accent.
meanings.sent4: The old building seemed to anglicize itself over time, blending in with the new architecture.
meanings.sent5: The artist anglicized the traditional painting style, creating a unique masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Modify (a word or name) to make it sound more English.
meanings.sent1: He anglicized the foreign word to make it easier to pronounce.
meanings.sent2: The company anglicized the product names for the international market.
meanings.sent3: The comedian anglicized his jokes, adding a British twist to his routine.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to anglicize the room, filling it with a sense of joy.
meanings.sent5: The music producer anglicized the lyrics, giving the song a universal appeal.
